creator: Ivan Mehta
title: (No AI) India’s Sarvam wants to bring its AI models to feature phones, cars and smart glasses
dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
content: The company is using edge models that take up only megabytes of space, can run on most phones with existing processors, and can work offline.
contentSnippet: The company is using edge models that take up only megabytes of space, can run on most phones with existing processors, and can work offline.

creator: Jagmeet Singh
title: (No AI) Indian AI lab Sarvam’s new models are a major bet on the viability of open-source AI
dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
content: The new lineup includes 30-billion and 105-billion parameter models; a text-to-speech model; a speech-to-text model; and a vision model to parse documents.
contentSnippet: The new lineup includes 30-billion and 105-billion parameter models; a text-to-speech model; a speech-to-text model; and a vision model to parse documents.

title: (No AI) Perplexity joins anti-ad camp as AI companies battle over trust and revenue
author: Robert Hart
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/STK271_PERPLEXITY_C.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

AI search startup Perplexity is distancing itself from ads amid fears users won't trust chatbots with an agenda to upsell. The move highlights an emerging crossroads for the AI industry as the sector's biggest players hunt for stable sources of income to bankroll massive spending, with giants like OpenAI leaning into ads and others like Anthropic promising to keep them out.

Perplexity began phasing out ads late last year and isn't exploring any new ad deals at the moment, executives said on Monday at a roundtable event, according to [_Business Insider_](https://www.businessinsider.com/perplexity-shifts-to-subscriptions-business-growth-2026-2) and the [_Financial Times_](https://www.ft.com/content/6eec07a5-34a8-4f78-a9ed-93ab4263d43c). It is a noteworthy U-turn for the US startup, which became one of …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/880562/perplexity-ditches-ai-ads)
contentSnippet:
AI search startup Perplexity is distancing itself from ads amid fears users won't trust chatbots with an agenda to upsell. The move highlights an emerging crossroads for the AI industry as the sector's biggest players hunt for stable sources of income to bankroll massive spending, with giants like OpenAI leaning into ads and others like Anthropic promising to keep them out. 
Perplexity began phasing out ads late last year and isn't exploring any new ad deals at the moment, executives said on Monday at a roundtable event, according to Business Insider and the Financial Times. It is a noteworthy U-turn for the US startup, which became one of  …

title: (No AI) Meta’s new deal with Nvidia buys up millions of AI chips
author: Stevie Bonifield
content:
![An illustration of the Meta logo](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/10/STK043_VRG_Illo_N_Barclay_1_Meta-1.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Meta has struck a multiyear deal to expand its data centers with millions of Nvidia's Grace and Vera CPUs and Blackwell and Rubin GPUs. While Meta has long been using Nvidia's hardware for its AI products, this deal "represents the first large-scale Nvidia Grace-only deployment," which [Nvidia says](https://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/meta-builds-ai-infrastructure-with-nvidia) will deliver "significant performance-per-watt improvements in \[Meta's\] data centers." The deal also includes plans to add Nvidia's next-generation Vera CPUs to Meta's data centers in 2027.

Meta is also [working on its own in-house chips](https://www.theverge.com/2024/2/1/24058179/meta-reportedly-working-on-a-new-ai-chip-it-plans-to-launch-this-year) for running AI models, but according to the [_Financial Times_](https://www.ft.com/content/d3b50dfc-31fa-45a8-9184-c5f0476f4504), it has run into "technical challenges and rollout …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/880513/nvidia-meta-ai-grace-vera-chips)

Meta has struck a multiyear deal to expand its data centers with millions of Nvidia's Grace and Vera CPUs and Blackwell and Rubin GPUs. While Meta has long been using Nvidia's hardware for its AI products, this deal "represents the first large-scale Nvidia Grace-only deployment," which Nvidia says will deliver "significant performance-per-watt improvements in [Meta's] data centers." The deal also includes plans to add Nvidia's next-generation Vera CPUs to Meta's data centers in 2027. 
Meta is also working on its own in-house chips for running AI models, but according to the Financial Times, it has run into "technical challenges and rollout  …
Read the full story at The Verge.

title: (No AI) GPT-5.2 derives a new result in theoretical physics
content: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.
contentSnippet: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.

title: (No AI) Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT
content: Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT to help organizations defend against prompt injection and AI-driven data exfiltration.

creator: Kyle MacNeill
title: (No AI) How Two Zoomers Created RentAHuman, the First Marketplace for Bots to Hire Humans

content: “We would \[all\] love to have an AI boss who wouldn't yell at you or gaslight you. Claude as a boss is the nicest guy ever.”

creator: Paresh Dave
title: (No AI) Meta and Other Tech Firms Put Restrictions on Use of OpenClaw Over Security Fears
dc:creator: Paresh Dave
content: Security experts have urged people to be cautious with the viral agentic AI tool, known for being highly capable but also wildly unpredictable.
contentSnippet: Security experts have urged people to be cautious with the viral agentic AI tool, known for being highly capable but also wildly unpredictable.
